definition: knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique

sentences.english: These be they who separate themselves, sensual, having not the Spirit.
sentences.chinese: 这就是那些引人结党，属乎血气，没有圣灵的人。

sentences.english: I am a little worried about my daughter ganging up with those tomboys.
sentences.chinese: 我有点担心我女儿会和那些野丫头成群结党。

sentences.english: The factory has not formulated the policy which prohibit form cliques for private gain.
sentences.chinese: 工厂没有制定书面的禁止结党营私的政策。

sentences.english: Is that why you have all conspired against me?

definition: to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
to gain from corrupt dealing/to engage in graft/to feather one's nest
to be narrowly partisan/to unite with those of the same views but alienate those with different views
to accuse/to impeach/(in imperial China) to level charges against an official
